fields.description:
Create detail page for ELB w/ action links 

Detail pages include:
- ELB General tab
- ELB Monitoring tab (tracked in GUI-1648)
- ELB Instances tab
- ELB Health Checks tab

fields.summary: Investigate JS charting libraries for metrics on ELB detail page

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

comments.body:
Pull request has been created for hand-off review and questions:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1391

Known issue:

  - The dropdown menu gets displayed outside of the viewing screen due to the Foundation's offset error when the menu was clicked on other tabs other than 'general-tab'.
[~jloza]: You probably need to UX review this before I code review it, right?  Also, now that we've implemented the HP branding, I'll merge master into the GUI-1483 branch before you UX review this.

yes, definitely. But, I'm out til Friday so if you want to make code changes between now and then that's OK and I can UX review when I get back. Especially in light on the change to separate the tab views.
[~kyolee]: Clicking the "Save Changes" button on any of the ELB tabs is returning an Internal Error.  Could you focus on fixing that this week?

[~spark]: We're observing a non-specific Internal Error response when creating or modifying ELBs in our console with Eucalyptus.  Since I'm not seeing that error with ELBs on AWS, I suspect it may have something to do with creating ELB tags.  Could you confirm if the latest Eucalyptus 4.2 code supports ELB tagging?

[~jloza]: Note that even if Eucalyptus supports ELB tagging, I'm nervous about supporting it in our console since we've added custom code as a workaround to Boto's lack of support for ELB tagging (see https://github.com/boto/boto/issues/2549).  Perhaps we should punt ELB tagging support to 4.3?
[~kgill] Tagging is supported in 4.2., and I suspect the issue is something different. If you point at me the CLC address I can take a look.

Yeah, let's track this one down. Thanks for your input so far, [~spark], hopefully we can figure out what's going on. 

Sounds like tagging itself isn't the issue, [~kgill] do you thnk we need to file a separate bug for that?

[~kgill] It appears the issue with the service. The wire message looks ok. I'll file a bug and fix.

Unrelated, but just curious: wondering why VPC network is required when creating a loadbalancer?
cc. [~jloza]
VPC definitely shouldn't be required, and I don't **think** it's written that way. Perhaps [~kyolee] has some input, he wrote this. The UX design works for either classic or VPC.

[~jloza]: I just tested saving ELB tags on Eucalyptus and it appears to work just fine, so the InternalError issue I mentioned earlier appears to be limited to saving the ELB's idle timeout setting, which [~spark] is working on.
Hooray!
[~kgill] The fix is pushed to master.
Perfect, thank you [~spark]!  BTW, what is the EUCA ticket number to track the ELB idle timeout fix on the backend?
[~kgill] EUCA-10862
[~kgill], give it a try. I ran the update and the cloud is up again.
[~kgill] there's a separate jira ticket for the cipher/cert stuff, so don't worry about it if you want to push this one through sooner.
PR at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1406
waitress error on general tab when non-vpc elb (problem with describing source security group)
punting back to investigate describe call for source security group

Back to you [~jloza].  The non-VPC ELB w/o the source security group on the 5.150 cloud (with acct-00/admin) was created a while ago (Feb 26), probably when our ELB wizard had a few bugs, which hopefully explains the missing source security group.  I haven't seen that issue in any other ELB, so I think we're safe now.

Looking good, [~kgill]! A couple of things:

On the General tab: 
* I had an HTTP listener. I tried to add an HTTPS listener, got an error related to certs (not worried about that since the cert stuff is still in flight) but my existing listener is no longer displaying. The table is gone. I then added a TCP listener and it successfully showed up in the table but my http listener is still gone. 

On the instances tab:

* The text that replaces the AZ selection widget when all have been selected needs a period at the end of the sentence. And, if all are selected, we could hide the enable button rather than disabling it. 
* When zone has unhealthy instances, I am not seeing a description in the tile. Just an instance count. 
* Also, I can't tell why these instances are labeled unhealthy. hey are running and seem to be fine? See jlo-test ELB in acct 00 on .150 cloud
* AZs and subnets in list should include instance count like they do in the create ELB wizard. Sorry I wasn't explicit about that in the wireframe, I assumed (wrongly) that the same person would be implementing both.
* If there are 0 instances in an enabled zone, would be clearer to not include status bar at bottom of tile rather than showing all healthy. 
* text in AZ/subnet status bars should be sentence case, not title case, please. 
* The text above the MSB widget could use a little more padding between. If this is a global fix we are addressing elsewhere, just let me know. 
* MSB includes security group as a facet for instances which should not be there. 
* Instances in the list that are checked should be reporting their status w/r/t the ELB, like in service or out of service, not the instance status like Running. Two instances that appear to be part of the LB show Running when I would be expecting them to indicate in or out of service. 
* instance count for AZ should reflect count in instance table. I removed 2 and added 1 (without checking save changes) and would like the AZ to reflect that. 
* I added an instance, and clicked save changes, and got an error back from teh cloud that my LB could not be found? Something is not behaving correctly, not sure what's going on. Could you help debug? Looking at the landing page, it's there. Save changes works OK if I add a listener or a tag on the general tab, so I think something isn't working right on the instances tab. 
* I then added my instance again, since i was starting from 0 now, and now the zone shows 1 unhealthy again (but the instance is fine) and also the instance is not checked in the list. All instances currently in the LB should be checked in the table. 

VPC specific:
* experience when all subnets have been enabled should be consistent with AZ experience. 
* Don't need VPC network filter on instances, just subnet.
* I got a weird cloud error when i tried to add an instance to the ELB. There may be some filtering we need to do to not show instances that can't be added because they are special somehow? I don't know why this instance is invalid, just that it is, because the error told me. Better to prevent the error in the first place.

[~jloza]: Here are my updates (added inline in brackets) for the issues you noted...

General Tab:
- I had an HTTP listener. I tried to add an HTTPS listener, got an error related to certs (not worried about that since the cert stuff is still in flight) but my existing listener is no longer displaying. The table is gone. I then added a TCP listener and it successfully showed up in the table but my http listener is still gone. [FIXED]

Instances Tab:
- The text that replaces the AZ selection widget when all have been selected needs a period at the end of the sentence. And, if all are selected, we could hide the enable button rather than disabling it. [DONE]
- When zone has unhealthy instances, I am not seeing a description in the tile. Just an instance count. [AFAICT neither the AWS API nor Boto has this info]
- Also, I can't tell why these instances are labeled unhealthy. They are running and seem to be fine? See jlo-test ELB in acct 00 on .150 cloud  [Hopefully clarified during sync-up]
- AZs and subnets in list should include instance count like they do in the create ELB wizard. Sorry I wasn't explicit about that in the wireframe, I assumed (wrongly) that the same person would be implementing both. [Let's open a separate ticket so we can move this along?]
- If there are 0 instances in an enabled zone, would be clearer to not include status bar at bottom of tile rather than showing all healthy. [DONE]
- Text in AZ/subnet status bars should be sentence case, not title case, please. [DONE]
- The text above the MSB widget could use a little more padding between. If this is a global fix we are addressing elsewhere, just let me know. [DONE]
- MSB includes security group as a facet for instances which should not be there. [DONE]
- Instances in the list that are checked should be reporting their status w/r/t the ELB, like in service or out of service, not the instance status like Running. Two instances that appear to be part of the LB show Running when I would be expecting them to indicate in or out of service. [DONE]
- Instance count for AZ should reflect count in instance table. I removed 2 and added 1 (without checking save changes) and would like the AZ to reflect that. [Can't fix this in current implementation]
- I added an instance, and clicked save changes, and got an error back from the cloud that my LB could not be found? Something is not behaving correctly, not sure what's going on. Could you help debug? Looking at the landing page, it's there. Save changes works OK if I add a listener or a tag on the general tab, so I think something isn't working right on the instances tab. [FIXED]
- I then added my instance again, since i was starting from 0 now, and now the zone shows 1 unhealthy again (but the instance is fine) and also the instance is not checked in the list. All instances currently in the LB should be checked in the table. [FIXED]

VPC Specific:
- Experience when all subnets have been enabled should be consistent with AZ experience. [DONE]
- Don't need VPC network filter on instances, just subnet. [DONE]
- I got a weird cloud error when i tried to add an instance to the ELB. There may be some filtering we need to do to not show instances that can't be added because they are special somehow? I don't know why this instance is invalid, just that it is, because the error told me. Better to prevent the error in the first place. [I haven't observed this after the latest 1.34 cloud update]

Other issues (discovered after initial UX review):
- Enabling/disabling zones/subnets on the Instances tab seems to be problematic on AWS [FIXED by adding validation check when no zones/subnets are selected]
- Move help bubble to port field label [DONE]
- Fix issues when a letter or a -1 is entered in the ELB port inputs [DONE]
- Add validation for ELB port (valid values) when Add Listener button is clicked [DONE]
- Status color for Running and InService instances should be green [DONE]
- Remove 1 from ELB healthy/unhealthy threshold drop-downs [DONE]

Back to you [~jloza].  I've fixed everything I can, and I'd like to get this code-reviewed by [~dkavanagh] Friday or early next week if possible, so if we could open new tickets for the remaining (non-critical) items to fix here that would be great.

* opened GUI-1822 to track issue with count update on instance tab tiles

will keep tabs on instance filtering requirements for invalid instances and file bug if that reappears. 

EXCELLENT job, [~kgill]! This was tough, I know. 

UX review passed, ready for code review, pending fix for display of validation error for instance side port invalid number. See attached screenshot, should look like validation error for client side port error. .

[~kgill], [~jloza], 2 things.
 - Clicking the ELB name from the ELB landing page takes me directly to the monitoring tab, even if all the graphs show "No Data Available".
 - When I go directly to the monitoring tab in FF, FF gradually hogs the CPU. I've done this twice in a row (about to try again). When I restart, it goes directly to monitoring, so that's the only page being hit, but it's bad. My laptop heats up and fans go faster and faster. (about to test in Chrome as well)
update: don't see this with Chrome. In FF, navigating away causes things to calm down. Could this be related to displaying graphs with no data? In Instances, we don't display empty graphs like that.

IDK why the charts are showing "no data available" but I think Kamal does. The monitoring tab should definitely be the default tab that displays for ELBs, that is the most critical information related to the behavior of the user's application and what they will most often want to see.

The D3 charting library displays "No data available" by default when the CloudWatch API call returns an empty list of data, which is the case for example if an ELB hasn't received any HTTP requests yet or doesn't have any metrics for the specified duration.

[~alice], [~ccassler], I wonder if you both can try to reproduce the problem I noticed. Pls try running package built from master last night (since I merged this branch yesterday). On OSX, run FF and navigate to an ELB detail page. by default, it will show the graphs. Leave the browser on this page and see if your laptop's fans start running after several minutes. If so, you can verify that FF is the culprit via the Activity Monitor. I found once I navigate away, the load goes down, but FF is bound to kill the CPU a short time later when using the console.
NOTE: I started noticing the fan going on in 2 minutes on my brand new MBP. After 3 minutes, it's at full force.

[~dkavanagh]: I'm not able to reproduce the CPU issue on Firefox (I'm running Yosemite on an early-2013 15" MBP).  After almost 10 minutes of sitting on the ELB Monitoring tab (with at least one chart displaying data), the machine's CPU usage stays below 10%, and I can't hear any fans.  I've attached a screenshot of Activity Monitor at the 5 min mark.
Released in 4.2
